name: app.R
content:
# app.R

# Load required libraries
library(shiny)

setwd("/Users/sqi/Desktop/6242_DVA/Project/cox_shiny")
# Source the R code file
source("functions.R")


# Define UI
ui <- fluidPage(
  titlePanel("Cox Proportional Hazards Model Predictor"),
  sidebarLayout(
    sidebarPanel(
      sliderInput("input_age", "Input Age:",
                  min = min(surv_data$age), max = max(surv_data$age), value = median(surv_data$age)),
      selectInput("input_gender", "Select Gender:", choices = c("Male", "Female"))
#      actionButton("plot_button", "Plot")
    ),
    mainPanel(
      plotOutput("survival_plot")
    )
  )
)

# Define server logic
server <- function(input, output) {
  # Plot survival curve
  output$survival_plot <- renderPlot({
    new_data <- data.frame(age = input$input_age, gender = input$input_gender)
    survfit(cox_model, newdata = new_data) %>%
      ggsurvplot(data = surv_data, palette = "Dark2", conf.int = TRUE) +
      ggtitle("Survival Curve with Confidence Interval")
  })
}

# Run the application
shinyApp(ui = ui, server = server)

name: functions.R
content:
# Load required libraries
library(survival)
library(survminer)
library(shiny)

# Generate sample survival data with age and gender
set.seed(123)
n <- 100
age <- runif(n, 20, 80)
gender <- sample(c("Male", "Female"), n, replace = TRUE)
time <- rexp(n, rate = 0.1)
status <- sample(0:1, n, replace = TRUE)
surv_data <- data.frame(time = time, status = status, age = age, gender = gender)

# Fit Cox proportional hazards model
cox_model <- coxph(Surv(time, status) ~ age + gender, data = surv_data)
